titlestmt.titleproper: Laurance S. Rockefeller papers, Early Files, Personal and Professional papers, RG 1
A Guide to the Laurance S. Rockefeller papers, Early Files, Personal and Professional papers, RG 1 FA1858

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-03-13 18:29:29 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Laurance S. Rockefeller papers, Early Files, Personal and Professional papers, RG 1

physdesc.extent: 9.5 letter-size document boxes, 7 legal-size document boxes, 1 oversized flat box (11" x 17"), 2 flat file folders (M, L).

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

Material in the Rockefeller family collections that provides the names, correspondence, or activities of living members of the Rockefeller family, and/or documents the net wealth of any Rockefeller family members, is restricted.

Material in the Laurance S. Rockefeller papers relating to communications with his immediate family, his personal finances, and other intra-family matters, is restricted until 2029, twenty years from the date of gift.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Rockefeller Archive Center has legal title, copyright, and literary property rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The executors of the Laurance S. Rockefeller Estate donated these records to the Rockefeller Archive Center by deed of gift in January 2009.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: RG 1 of the Laurance S. Rockefeller (LSR) papers consists primarily of personal papers gathered from his Kent House (Tarrytown) and 834 Fifth Avenue (NY) residences. The collection includes LSR's correspondence with his parents, friends, and family from childhood into adulthood; schooling, college, law-school, and early professional papers; records of his naval service and aviation interests; wedding and engagement records; travel records; and some personal financial records.

While most of the papers come from LSR's home, they were created and maintained at different times and places. His mother, Abby Aldrich Rockefeller (AAR), kept some of these papers, which came to LSR only after her death in 1948. The collection also includes a few materials of a more historical or antiquarian interest.

LSR's correspondence may seem particularly illuminating of the social life of a privileged college student, but the correspondence also provides insight into his upbringing and descriptions of more formative experiences such as LSR's participation in the Grenfell expedition to Labrador in 1929, the Princeton Geology Trip in 1930, and his trip to Jasper National Park in 1932 as a wildlife photographer for American Nature Association founder Arthur N. Pack.
As a lieutenant and then lieutenant commander in the Navy from 1942-1945, LSR was assigned to the Navy's Bureau of Aeronautics, where he served as assistant head of the Aircraft Production Section.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Laurance S. Rockefeller (LSR) papers, RG 1, Early Files, Personal and Professional Papers, draws together materials from several accessions, in whole or part, of personal papers from LSR's homes. Unlike LSR's general files or other papers, these materials were not organized or maintained by the Rockefeller Family Office.

Materials from these accessions have been grouped together in a single arrangement generally by subject or document type, and then, imperfectly, by date. While the materials are arranged in a single series, files pertaining to LSR's naval service are distinct in subject and nature from the other files.

scopecontent.p: Folders include photos and brochure concerning Princeton Summer Camp (1930) and LSR's letters on the Princeton Geology trip (1930); plus his letters from Europe in 1931, and from his Jasper National Park trip in 1932.

did.unittitle: Lucy Truman Aldrich Correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Also includes letter from Nelson A. Rockefeller to Lucy Truman Aldrich, January 14, 1949, and letter from John D.Rockefeller, Jr., March 15, 1949, enclosing group photos of JDR, Jr. and his sons, and of Babs and her sisters-in-law, 1949. Also includes earlier formal photo of AAR with her daughter and daughters-in-law.

did.unittitle: Friends and Associates Correspondence (A - Day)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Atta Albertson; Henry Alpern; Edith J. Baerwald; Pierre Benoit, 1926-1928 (had been LSR's French tutor; includes photos); Beta Rothafel Bijur; Betty Nugent Blackiston and H.C. (Harry) Blackiston, Jr.; Thatcher Brown concerning Helen Brown; Wilhelmus (Bill) b. Bryan, Jr. and Katharine (Kit) MacKenty Bryan; Otis W. Caldwell; Marion Rumsey Cartier; Zechariah Chafee, Jr.; Chan Chunman, 1921 (copy of letter concerning JDR Jr. and AAR's trip to China); Lucy Anne Colpitts; "Cally"; J. Lionberger Davis; George Vietor Davis; Joseph P. Day.

did.unittitle: Friends and Associates Correspondence (De - F)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes: Frank Debenham and Dorothy Lempriere Debenham; George and Margaret Strong DeCuevas; James C. Donnell, Jr. and Dolly Devine Donnell; Elizabeth Douglas; E.B.M. "Emilie"; Fannie Evans; F.C.W. "Faith"; James L. Faunce; Abraham Flexner; Mignon E. (Miggs) Foerderer; Harry Emerson Fosdick; Raymond B. Fosdick; F.F.H. "Fran"; Helen Francis; John French; Rhoda Walker French; Elisha M. Friedman.

did.unittitle: Friends and Associates Correspondence (G-I)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes: Maud Ely Gibbons; G.D. Oswald Gockler /Daniel Gauclair; Harmon Goldstone; Albert T. Gould; Sir Wilfred Grenfell; Robert H. Gumbel; Eugene Henderson, Hampton Institute; Anita Candler Hinckley (including a request for help with a term paper on Diego Rivera, 1933?); Don [Hooker?]; Russell Houghton Hooker.

did.unittitle: Friends and Associates Correspondence (J-O)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes: Phil Jessup; Maggi (Margaret) Shea Johnson; Rufus M. Jones; "Kathleen," 1929; Lillian M. Kline; Michael Kopliner; Susan Kronthal; B. Lamb; "Lily"; Jere Lord; Donald B. MacMillan; "Marty"; Otakar Matousek; Cyrus H. McCormick; Harold McCormick; McCormick, Muriel; "Mizzie" or "Miggie" (MMR); Peggy [de Morinni?]; Margaret Elizabeth ("Betty") Nichols; Jane Northrup.

did.unittitle: Friends and Associates Correspondence (P-R)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Inclues: Arthur N. Pack and Eleanor Brown (Brownie) Pack, 1932-1934; Lee Palfrey; "Pauline"; Gertrude Peabody; Bill Piel; John Wolcott Porter; Betty Pratt; Natalie Pulsifer; Dr. Paul Ramdohr; E. Lansing Ray, Jr.; Henri Reynier; Will Rogers (copy, undated); Frin [Rousmaniere]; Polly Rousmaniere.

did.unittitle: Friends and Associates Correspondence (S-Z)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Elizabeth (Betty) Saltonstall; Reverend M. Huyett Sangree ("San"); Hans Schneiderhoehn; Elizabeth Hibben Scoon; J. Lyndon Shanley; Charles Sheeler; Don Sheldon; Dorothea K. Shipway; "Skillet"; H. Alexander Smith; Eleanor A. Smyth; Frederic Soldwedel; "Susan" [?], and Anne Sibley; "Teddy"; Andre Trocme, 1928; "Scally" [Challis Walker]; Robert R. Wicks; Lillie Distler Woelfkin (Mrs. Cornelius Woelfkin); Wallace F. Worthley, 1924; Y. Yishikawa.

did.unittitle: Friends and Associates Correspondence (General)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous later correspondence, mainly from 1944-1949. Includes, among others: telegrams from Pete Kriendler and Jacob Javits, 1974; Harper Woodward; Horace Albright, 1963; Robert Trent Jones, 1963, with 2 snapshots; Peggy Rockefeller; A. K. Morgan, 1945, 1956, and map of Palisades Interstate Park; Bill Duncan, 1947; Mary M. B. French, 1945, concerning Zoological Society Meeting; Childs Frick, 1945; George D. Owen, Union Church, 1944; Jesse H. Knight, 1945, concerning business interests in Colombia; Lewis Valentine letter of introduction for LSR and MFR, 1940; John French, 1947, 1979; Wallace Harrison, undated notes; Donal O'Brien to LSR, 1999, enclosing letter from Nelson A. Rockefeller to Thomas Debevoise, 1952, concerning sale of Hills Realty stock to the Brothers' generation. Also includes a few unidentified telegrams and notes, 1929-1934.

did.unittitle: Naval Service - Bureau of Aeronautics - Memoranda and Reports - Oversized Drawings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Oversized drawings and charts separated from Box 14, folders 154-156:
Folder 154: Analysis of Production Loading for Airplane Departments (June 1943 - ). [27" x 22"]
Folder 155: General Layout GACA Buildings and Airport, March 27, 1944. Plant Planning Drawing no. PP369-1. Inscription: Encl. (2), BAR ltr. 4-10-44. [15" x 17"]
G.A.C. Plant Layout, Goodyear Aircraft Corporation, Arizona Division, Litchfield Park, Arizona, December 7, 1943. Plant Planning Drawing no. PP371-4. Negative photostatic copy. [10" x 19"]
Folder 156: Daily Production Progress Report. Bureau of Aeronautics Representative, Consolidated Vultee Aircraft Corporation, New Orleans Division, January 16, 1945. [14" x 27"]

Airplane Production Progress Report, Model FR-1 Airplane, W-13 Schedule – Excluding Spares, Posted through March 18, 1945. Ryan Aeronautical Co., Lindbergh Field, San Diego, California. Photostatic print. Two copies (one separated, and one retained in the file). [11" x 22"]
Bureau of Aeronautics, Analysis of Naval Production Airframe Contracts, January 1, 1941 through April 30, 1945. 7 pp. [17" x 22"]
Bureau of Aeronautics, Average Unit Contract Prices Navy Airplanes. May 1, 1945. 4 pages, plus Appendix (1 page). [17" x 22"]

scopecontent.p: Includes Standard Oil Company "Information for Employees" booklet, 1927.

did.unittitle: Clippings, Pamphlets, and Notes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder 174 includes Lucy Truman Aldrich's account of her "Week-End with Chinese Bandits" (1923); New York Times and Philadelphia Evening Bulletin articles on the Grenfell Mission, 1930; and miscellaneous clippings concerning friends and family. Folder 175 includes a copy of JDR Jr's address at the Dedication of the Chapel at the University of Chicago, October 28, 1928; plus various clippings and notes on Philosophy and other topics.

did.unittitle: Pamphlets

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes pamphlets by John D. Rockefeller, JDR Jr., Wallace Buttrick, J. Lionberger Davis, Harry Emerson Fosdick, and several others.

did.unittitle: Appointment Books
Naval Service - Separated Oversized Publications

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Oversized publications and pamphlets from Boxes 13-15, folders 147-165:
Box 13, Folder 147:
Lockheed Log, Vol. 3, no. 4, undated
Boeing Stratocruiser. Boeing Aircraft Company publication, undated.
Box 14, Folder 151:

Broadside pamphlet: "Order Early: Aircraft Materials and Components. Time Flow Charts for Selected Aircraft Components." Prepared for Aircraft Scheduling Unit by Resources Control Section – Production Division. AAF Material Command, Wright Field, Dayton, Ohio, 27 March 1944.
Box 14, Folder 158:
"Outfitting a War Lady." Etching by Kent Hagerman, of the U.S.S. Piedmont under construction. Distributed by the Tampa Shipbuilding Company, undated.
Air Ads, Vol. 1, no. 13, January 20, 1945. Published in the Interests of the Central States Air Men, St. Cloud, MN.
Box 15, Folder 165:
The Navy Plan for National Security. US Navy Department. Undated broadside pamphlet.
